qas.question: What percentage of Devon's GVA does Plymouth comprise in 2013?
What was Plymouth's 2013 GVA in millions of British Pounds?
What was Plymouth' per capita GVA in 2013?
What was the United Kingdom's average per capita GVA in 2013?
What percentage of Plymouth residents were unemployed in 2014?

context: Plymouth's gross value added (a measure of the size of its economy) was <a1_0>5,169<a1_0/> million GBP in 2013 making up <a0_0>25%<a0_0/> of Devon's GVA. Its GVA per person was <a2_0>£19,943<a2_0/> and compared to the national average of <a3_0>£23,755<a3_0/>, was £3,812 lower. Plymouth's unemployment rate was <a4_0>7.0%<a4_0/> in 2014 which was 2.0 points higher than the South West average and 0.8 points higher than the average for Great Britain (England, Wales and Scotland).
